Diagram title: A hierarchical network in a medium-sized business. The diagram compares logical and physical layouts for a hierarchical network model.

Logical Layout: This is the same as Diagram 1. It consists of Access, Distribution, and Core layers, along with the associated device icons. The logical representation makes it easy to see which devices perform at each specific layer.

Physical Layout: This depicts similar network components, but shows the physical devices and their actual locations in a multilevel building floorplan. E-mail servers and database servers are located in a room on the first floor. User computers are located in various rooms on the second floor. A rack with an Access Layer switch and a Distribution Layer switch is located in a wiring closet on the second floor.
